```{r}
library(tidyverse)

url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2022/2022-01-18/chocolate.csv"
chocolate <- read_csv(url)

chocolate %>%
  ggplot(aes(rating)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 15)
```

```

summary(chocolate)
```

```{r}
colnames(chocolate)
```
```{r}
#What are the most common words used to describe the most memorable characteristics of each chocolate sample?

library(tidytext)

tidy_chocolate <-
  chocolate %>%
  unnest_tokens(word, most_memorable_characteristics)

tidy_chocolate %>%
  count(word, sort = TRUE)
```

```{r}
#By implementing count() here with arguments of both word and sentiment, we find out how much each word contributed to each sentiment.

bing_word_counts <- tidy_chocolate %>%
  inner_join(get_sentiments("bing")) %>%
  count(word, sentiment, sort = TRUE) %>%
  ungroup()

bing_word_counts
```
```{r}
#Words that contribute to positive and negative sentiment in Jane Austenâ€™s novels

bing_word_counts %>%
  group_by(sentiment) %>%
  slice_max(n, n = 10) %>% 
  ungroup() %>%
  mutate(word = reorder(word, n)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(n, word, fill = sentiment)) +
  geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +
  facet_wrap(~sentiment, scales = "free_y") +
  labs(x = "Contribution to sentiment",
       y = NULL)
```
```{r}
library(wordcloud)

tidy_chocolate %>%
  anti_join(stop_words) %>%
  count(word) %>%
  with(wordcloud(word, n, max.words = 100))
```
```{r}
#comparision cloud

library(reshape2)

tidy_chocolate %>%
  inner_join(get_sentiments("bing")) %>%
  count(word, sentiment, sort = TRUE) %>%
  acast(word ~ sentiment, value.var = "n", fill = 0) %>%
  comparison.cloud(colors = c("red", "green"),
                   max.words = 100)
```
